[h1]continue[/h1]

The [b]continue [/b]statement is similar to the [b]break [/b]statement, but instead of terminating the loop entirely, it skips the current iteration of the loop and continues with the next iteration.
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="cs" codeId="846"]for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
  if (i == 5)
    [b]continue;[/b]

  Console.WriteLine(i);
}
/* Outputs:
0
1
2
3
4
6
7
8
9
*/[/code]
[note]As you can see, number 5 is not printed, as the [b]continue [/b]statement skips the remaining statements of that iteration of the loop.[/note]
